verses.esv:
4   The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
    while the soul of the diligent is richly supplied.
verses.kjv: 4 The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.niv: 4 The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.

verses.esv: 15 Look carefully then how you walk, not as unwise but as wise, 16 making the best use of the time, because the days are evil. 17 Therefore do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
verses.kjv: 15 See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise, 16 Redeeming the time, because the days are evil. 17 Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.
verses.niv: 15 Be very careful, then, how you live--not as unwise but as wise, 16 making the most of every opportunity, because the days are evil. 17 Therefore do not be foolish, but understand what the Lord's will is.

verses.esv:
24   The hand of the diligent will rule,
    while the slothful will be put to forced labor.
verses.kjv: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
verses.niv: 24 Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.

verses.esv:
4   The sluggard does not plow in the autumn;
    he will seek at harvest and have nothing.
verses.kjv: 4 The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
verses.niv: 4 A sluggard does not plow in season; so at harvest time he looks but finds nothing.

verses.esv:
27:1   Do not boast about tomorrow,
    for you do not know what a day may bring.
verses.kjv: 1 Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
verses.niv: 1 Do not boast about tomorrow, for you do not know what a day may bring forth.

verses.esv: 17 So whoever knows the right thing to do and fails to do it, for him it is sin.
verses.kjv: 17 Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.
verses.niv: 17 Anyone, then, who knows the good he ought to do and doesn't do it, sins.

verses.esv: 59 To another he said, “Follow me.” But he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.” 60 And Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead. But as for you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God.” 61 Yet another said, “I will follow you, Lord, but let me first say farewell to those at my home.” 62 Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.kjv: 59 And he said unto another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father. 60 Jesus said unto him, Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God. 61 And another also said, Lord, I will follow thee; but let me first go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house. 62 And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
verses.niv: 59 He said to another man, "Follow me." But the man replied, "Lord, first let me go and bury my father." 60 Jesus said to him, "Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God." 61 Still another said, "I will follow you, Lord; but first let me go back and say good bye to my family." 62 Jesus replied, "No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God."

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 11 For the moment all discipline seems painful rather than pleasant, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
verses.kjv: 11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.
verses.niv: 11 No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.

verses.esv: 33 But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you.
verses.kjv: 33 But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.niv: 33 But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

verses.esv:
25   Anxiety in a man’s heart weighs him down,
    but a good word makes him glad.
verses.kjv: 25 Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
verses.niv: 25 An anxious heart weighs a man down, but a kind word cheers him up.

verses.esv: 4 We must work the works of him who sent me while it is day; night is coming, when no one can work.
verses.kjv: 4 I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.
verses.niv: 4 As long as it is day, we must do the work of him who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.

verses.esv: 40 You also must be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”
verses.kjv: 40 Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.
verses.niv: 40 You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him."

verses.esv: 35 “Stay dressed for action and keep your lamps burning,
verses.kjv: 35 Let your loins be girded about, and your lights burning;
verses.niv: 35 "Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning,

verses.esv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might, for there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in Sheol, to which you are going.
verses.kjv: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.niv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.

verses.esv:
4   He who observes the wind will not sow,
    and he who regards the clouds will not reap.
verses.kjv: 4 He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap.
verses.niv: 4 Whoever watches the wind will not plant; whoever looks at the clouds will not reap.

verses.esv:
23   In all toil there is profit,
    but mere talk tends only to poverty.
verses.kjv: 23 In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
verses.niv: 23 All hard work brings a profit, but mere talk leads only to poverty.

verses.esv:
20 Now if I do what I do not want, it is no longer I who do it, but sin that dwells within me.

21 So I find it to be a law that when I want to do right, evil lies close at hand.
verses.kjv: 20 Now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me. 21 I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me.
verses.niv: 20 Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who do it, but it is sin living in me that does it. 21 So I find this law at work: When I want to do good, evil is right there with me.

verses.esv: 9 And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up.
verses.kjv: 9 And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.niv: 9 Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

verses.esv:
4   A slack hand causes poverty,
    but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.kjv: 4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
verses.niv: 4 Lazy hands make a man poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.

verses.esv:
9   Whoever is slack in his work
    is a brother to him who destroys.
verses.kjv: 9 He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.niv: 9 One who is slack in his work is brother to one who destroys.

verses.esv: 2 For you yourselves are fully aware that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.
verses.kjv: 2 For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.
verses.niv: 2 for you know very well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.

verses.esv:
28   Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again,
    tomorrow I will give it”—when you have it with you.
verses.kjv: 28 Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
verses.niv: 28 Do not say to your neighbor, "Come back later; I'll give it tomorrow"- when you now have it with you.

verses.esv:
60   I hasten and do not delay
    to keep your commandments.
verses.kjv: 60 I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
verses.niv: 60 I will hasten and not delay to obey your commands.

verses.esv: 40 But all things should be done decently and in order.
verses.kjv: 40 Let all things be done decently and in order.
verses.niv: 40 But everything should be done in a fitting and orderly way.
